config.question: Which aspect do you think our course focuses on?

title: Software Engineering Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic software engineering concepts and principles

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the Waterfall model in software engineering?
options: A linear sequential development approach where each phase must be completed before the next begins
An iterative development approach that emphasizes flexibility and customer collaboration
A model that combines elements of both sequential and iterative development
A development approach focused exclusively on rapid prototyping
questions.explanation: The Waterfall model is a linear sequential development approach where progress flows steadily downward through phases like requirements, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of version control systems like Git in software engineering?
options: To track changes in source code and enable collaboration among developers
To automatically generate documentation for software projects
To optimize code performance and reduce execution time
To convert source code into executable machine code
questions.explanation: Version control systems like Git are used to track changes in source code, manage different versions of software, and facilitate collaboration among multiple developers working on the same project.

title: Software Engineering Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic software engineering concepts and principles

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a phase in the traditional software development lifecycle?
questions.explanation: Debugging is an activity that occurs during implementation and testing phases, but it is not considered a separate phase in the traditional SDLC which typically includes Requirements, Design, Implementation, Testing, and Maintenance.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of version control systems like Git in software engineering?
options: To compile source code into executable programs
To track changes and manage different versions of source code
To automatically fix bugs in the code
questions.explanation: Version control systems like Git are primarily used to track changes to source code over time, allowing multiple developers to collaborate, manage different versions, and revert to previous states when needed.

title: Software Engineering Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic software engineering concepts and principles

questions.question: Which software development methodology emphasizes iterative development and customer collaboration?
questions.explanation: Agile methodology focuses on iterative development, frequent delivery, and close collaboration with customers throughout the development process.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of version control systems like Git in software engineering?
options: To track changes and manage different versions of code
questions.explanation: Version control systems help developers track changes to source code over time, manage different versions, and collaborate effectively with team members.

title: Software Engineering Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of software engineering principles, methodologies, and best practices. This quiz covers key concepts from software development lifecycle, requirements engineering, design patterns, testing, and project management.

questions.question: Which software development methodology emphasizes iterative development and customer collaboration?
questions.explanation: Agile Methodology focuses on iterative development, frequent delivery, and close collaboration with customers throughout the development process.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of version control systems like Git in software engineering?
questions.explanation: Version control systems manage changes to source code over time, enabling multiple developers to collaborate while maintaining code history and integrity.

questions.question: Which testing level focuses on individual units or components of software?
questions.explanation: Unit testing verifies that individual units or components of the software work correctly in isolation from other parts.

questions.question: What does the SOLID principle in object-oriented design represent?
options: Five design principles for maintainable code
questions.explanation: SOLID is an acronym for five design principles (Single Responsibility, Open-Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion) that make software designs more understandable, flexible, and maintainable.

questions.question: In software requirements engineering, what is the difference between functional and non-functional requirements?
options: Functional requirements describe what the system should do, while non-functional describe how well it should perform
Functional requirements are technical, while non-functional are business-oriented
Functional requirements are optional, while non-functional are mandatory
questions.explanation: Functional requirements specify what the system should do (features and functions), while non-functional requirements specify how well the system should perform (performance, security, usability, etc.).
